fields.summary: Only allow prefixes accessible for a widget to be used for identity mapping

issuetype.description: Issue
issuetype.name: Issue

fields.description: The widget server currently accepts any customer prefix for identity mapping, which is considered a security problem. The way we do this with /profile/user/segment is to only use prefixes for the requested site group ids. Something similar could be done for the widget server.

fields.summary: Remove fallback to ckp/gckp/usi in widget server

issuetype.description: Issue
issuetype.name: Issue

fields.description:
Forked off from CXANA-5507.

We no longer want to "upgrade" ckp/gckp/usi to globalId. In such situations, we want to generate a deterministic globalId, using available identifiers and the siteId (see AnalyticsIdUtil.generateGlobalId()). This will prevent information leakage between customers and avoid race conditions between different requests and give us the same globalId.

fields.summary: Venezuelan time zone changed 30 minutes on May 1st.  - Any possible implications

issuetype.description: Issue
issuetype.name: Issue

fields.description:
Customer: Telesur
[Support Ticket 12199  | https://emediate1.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/12199]

On May 1st, 2016, the time in the timezone for Venezuela changed by 30 minutes.  "forward 30 minutes"

Insight reports have not been accurate when mapping to local time after that time.  Major events show up in insight statistics 30 minutes too early.    Can you check the backend to see if we need to update something manually after this timezone was altered?

The siteId that have been used to illustrate the problem is this one:   "9222352440756601877"
which has

"timeZone": "America/Caracas",


{code}
joar@onb-de1:~$ /config/bin/cx.py /site  '{"siteId":"9222352440756601877","admin":true}'
{
  "sites": [
    {
      "id": "9222352440756601877",
      "name": "teleSUR",
      "url": "www.telesurtv.net",
      "domains": [],
      "country": "VE",
      "timeZone": "America/Caracas",
      "createdBy": "jvillegas@telesurtv.net",
      "createdAt": "2014-07-17T16:08:13.419Z",
      "parentSiteGroupIds": [
        "1127151559477373332",
        "9222342180420822879",
        "9222356687058974874"
      ],
      "permissions": [
        {
          "username": "joar.saether@cxense.com",
          "read": true,
          "write": true
        }
      ],
      "historyStart": 1463244885,
      "dmp": false,
      "sentimentDetection": false,
      "automaticCrawling": true,
      "customers": [
        ""
      ]
    }
  ]
}

fields.summary: cx.py tool returning error when response contains un-handled characters

issuetype.description: Issue
issuetype.name: Issue

fields.description:
*Customer:* 
Name:zappallas
siteGroupId:1146327961620383962 

*[Support Ticket 13067|https://emediate1.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/13067]*

*Summary:*
cx.py tool throwing error when retrieving external user profile data.

*Business Impact:*
Support not able to troubleshoot and fix wrongly uploaded 1st party data.

*Details:*
I am trying to use cx.py tool to get external user profile data for ZAPPALLAS (customer prefix 'zap'), which is required in the process of solving ticket #13067:

{code}
python cx.py /profile/user/external/read '{"type":"zap"}'
{code}

For any other customer prefix than "zap" that I have tried it with, it works nicely (even with other Japanese customers prefixes such as "dlc" )
However, for "zap" we get the error below. Data seems to have been corrupted or changed so that tool takes it for a dictionary instead of the string it is expecting:

{code}
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "cx.py", line 186, in <module>
    print(json.dumps(json.loads(response, object_pairs_hook=collections.OrderedDict), indent=2, ensure_ascii=ensure_ascii))
  File "json\__init__.py", line 312, in loads
TypeError: the JSON object must be str, not 'dict'
{code}

status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: Cxense ID (former Global ID) exposed in client side APIs

issuetype.description: A big user story that needs to be broken down.
issuetype.name: Epic

fields.description:
* Store the global id in the client. This is now possible given the new boxed global identifier. Then we don't have to do any mapping using the identityserver, which gives us both a performance boost and a much more solid system with higher reliability.
* Provide a new cx.js based function for retrieving the boxed global identifer. This should solve a lot of third party integration, where the cxense user identifier has given us trouble.

fields.summary: Setting up new monitoring to check retargeting delay

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
*Summary:*
Requesting a new monitoring that will check retargeting delay (i.e. the time between a retargeting parameter is added to user profile and the parameter appears in the response to /internal/ad/context request.

*Background:*
We had a retargeting problem at a customer (CXANA-5541). It was undetected and lasted several days unnoticed until the customer complained; by the time the customer noticed it had become a fairly serious issue.

The situation is expected to be improved once we address CXANA-3890, but until then, we should have a monitoring in place so that this type of problems can be detected and worked on.

*Current custom monitoring setup:*
I have a simple monitoring script running hourly on tks01.cxense.com (the actual code shown below). It does the following:

# Send a fake PV event with a retargeting parameter (ckp is randomly generated, so it will be a new user each time)
# Call /internal/ad/context API to see if the retargeting parameter appears in the response
# If the delay is extensive, an email alert gets sent

It doesn't have to be exactly like this as long as the monitoring can detect unusual delay.

{code}
#!/bin/bash

MAILFROM=no-reply@cxense.com
MAILTO=tech_jp@cxense.com

SITEID=9222302702321341959
URL=http%3A%2F%2Fcxnews.azurewebsites.net%2F

export LC_CTYPE=C

for retry_count in {0..10}
do
    rnd=`tr -dc 'a-z0-9' < /dev/urandom | fold -w ${1:-17} | head -n 1`
    cks=`tr -dc 'a-z0-9' < /dev/urandom | fold -w ${1:-17} | head -n 1`
    ckp=`tr -dc 'a-z0-9' < /dev/urandom | fold -w ${1:-17} | head -n 1`
    altm=`date +"%s"`
    altm=$altm"000"
    rnd=`tr -dc 'a-z0-9' < /dev/urandom | fold -w ${1:-17} | head -n 1`

    curl -s "https://scomcluster.cxense.com/Repo/rep.gif?ver=1&typ=pgv&rnd=${rnd}&acc=0&sid=${SITEID}&loc=${URL}&ref=&gol=&pgn=&ltm=${altm}&new=0&arf=0&tzo=-540&res=2560x1440&dpr=1&col=24&jav=0&bln=ja&cks=${cks}&ckp=${ckp}&chs=UTF-8&wsz=1752x852&altm=${altm}&arnd=iozpzvjg4feq82vn&aatm=11&axtl=&awsz=1402x730&amvw=1402x1370&fls=1&flv=Shockwave%20Flash%2021.0%20r0&cp_t_type=rental" > /dev/null

    for i in {0..5}
    do
	/config/bin/cx.py /internal/ad/context "{\"brokerId\":\"000000015f127e3e\",\"features\":[\"behavioral\"],\"url\":null,\"user\":[\"cX_P:${ckp}\"],\"adSpaces\":[{\"adSpaceId\":\"0000000162ef9858\",\"contextualWeight\":100,\"behavioralWeight\":100}]}" | grep rental > /dev/null
	if [ $? = 0 ]; then
	    break
	else
	    sleep 1
	fi
    done
    if [ $i -lt 5 ]; then
	break
    fi
done

if [ $retry_count = 10 ]; then
    echo "Retargeting delay more than 5 seconds!" > email.txt
    mailx -s "ALERT: Retargeting Delay" -r $MAILFROM $MAILTO < email.txt
fi

exit 0
{code}

fields.summary: DMP funnel steps are not sorted numerically

issuetype.description: Issue
issuetype.name: Issue

fields.description:
[Support Ticket 13313 |  https://emediate1.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/13313] 

Summary:
When a funnel has 9 steps, clicking "Add Step" adds the new step (10th step) to the second position from the top. So, the funnel steps are ordered as 1, 10, 2, 3, etc. Please find the attached screenshot for your reference.

Repro steps:

1. Go to https://insight.cxense.com with any browser
2. Select any site group
3. Go to "DMP" > "Funnels" > "Create Funnel"
4. Add 10 steps to the funnel

Observed behavior: the 10th step will be added to the second position of the funnel

fields.summary: Time Zone options in Create Site is disregarded when pressing "Create Site" button

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
Summary
The create site GUI is not using the timezone selected by the user when creating sites.  It always picks the first timezone choice in the drop down.

Consequense is that a large portioni of sites created have wrong timezone because most customers do not see this.


*Repro steps*

Go to Create Site dialogue in Insight GUI
Fill in Name, URL Site Group and Country.
In the Time Zone drop down, select any line other than the top one

*Observe:*  When you press the Create Site button, the Time Zone jumps back to the top one in the list of timezones valid for the country

*Expected:*  The GUI should make use of the value that the user selected

fields.summary: Allow customer to input keyword weights in meta tags

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

fields.description:
*Customer:* 
Customer Name : Mediacorp Pte Ltd
Site group id: 1145186771859738307
Site id: 1146326845481641928

*[Support Ticket 13241|https://emediate1.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/13241]*

*Summary:*
New Feature Request: Allow customer to input keyword weights in meta tags

*Business Impact:*
Improves the contextual matching results with their own keywords. 

*Details:*
Cxense only allows customer to provide keywords via meta tags. The ability for customers to specify keyword weights is not supported, all meta tag provided keywords end up with a weight of 1.0

Today meta tag looks like this:
{code}<meta name="cXenseParse:xyz-keywords" content="Lee Hsien Loong">{code}

The customer requests something like this:
{code}
<meta name="cXenseParse:xyz-keywords" content="very releavent word" weight="0.92">
<meta name="cXenseParse:xyz-keywords" content="not very releavent word" weight="0.31">
{code}

According to the customer, the weight of keywords plays an important role in finding the most similar stories,

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.summary: Rakuten requirements; offline PV event push

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

fields.description:
*Prospect:* Rakuten (LinkShare Japan)
*Salesforce:* https://eu3.salesforce.com/006w000000jNl5h

*Summary:*
Rakuten distributes a browser toolbar to their users. The toolbar collects every page visit on the browser (not only the Rakuten site, but *any* sites).
Rakuten would like to feed these events to Cxense offline (perhaps daily basis) -- supposedly the data contains the Rakuten userid, visited URLs, queries made on the browser, and time stamp of each event.
They will then create segments based on the events; e.g. "users who visited site A during the last X days", or "users who made queries for this specific term".

In order to satisfy their requirements, we need the following:

# ability (API) to send offline PV events in batches, respecting timestamp of the events
# ability to filter traffic using filters like this: "http://www.example.com/foo/bar/*" -- the segments they would like to create will be based on such queries. Since we wouldn't be crawling the pages, content profile based filters like category/taxonomy wouldn't work.

(I've created a separate ticket for the second requirement (CXANA-5586). This ticket should address the first requirement only).

The estimated number of events to be pushed is 800 million per month. Also note that they would like to do an initial feed of the last 6 months worth of data.

I have had a brief discussion on (part of) this topic on cx-nuggets a while back:
https://groups.google.com/a/cxense.com/forum/?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer#!msg/cx-nuggets/4zyFvJZayVc/zjDEp4h2EQAJ

Note: Use of DMP event was considered for this purpose but URLs would be too long for event parameter (the parameter length is limited to 20 chars).

fields.summary: Overlap screen in DMP editor silently fails when sitegroup has more than one site - Need feedback to the user

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
Customer.  PRISA
[Support Ticket 13128| https://emediate1.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/13128]

=== scope === 
Opened

* one segment: 8n2jlrre5bp3 
* from siteGroup: 1145197832655542298 
* which contains "dmp-event" and "dmp-custom" filters
* ths siteGroup has two sites
* -->  go here:   https://dmp.cxense.com/segments-edit?group=1145197832655542298&site=9222275987287867960&begin=sod&end=now&segment=8n2jlrre5bp3&selectedWorkspaceId=251c824e32b8b2d3eb0103834652e06ee1901a63 

Click  "Overlap" 

Observe: nothing happens.
Expected:   some kind of error/explanation returned to the user

=== issue === 
The API requests fail with:

{"error":"Invalid request: The uniqueUsers field is not supported for queries over more than 1 site when querying or filtering on DMP data."}

Due to the fact, that only "customer cubes" will support this.

=== request === 
Feedback for the user is needed, that this is not supported. 
Or don't make "Overlap" available at all (grey out), if it is not supported by this type of segment.

=== customer impact === 
PRISA right now waited for this feature, but it will give them a bad experience right now.

fields.summary: Add segment type dmp

issuetype.description: A big user story that needs to be broken down.
issuetype.name: Epic

fields.description:
Now that we have introduced the segment type traffic and external, the time has come to add support for dmp segments.

A dmp segment is a segment that extracts members directly from the dmp cubes, similar to traffic segment which extracts members from the pageview history cubes. This will make it possible to handle scenarios where we only have dmp events and not any pageview events.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

security.name: Private internal

fields.summary: Add segment type lookalike

issuetype.description: A big user story that needs to be broken down.
issuetype.name: Epic

fields.description:
Add lookalike segments as a first-class citizen with its own type "lookalike".

It should be possible to create a new segment of type segment, where it should be possible to configure the segment to be used for the lookalike model, in addition to other tuning parameters. It should be possible to have multiple such segments with different lookalike configuration for the same target segment.

Segment events for these new segments should be fed to the cube, similar to the existing lookalike segment events, but probably we need to add a new type since the existing events represents the segment being used in the lookalike model.

The new solution should not involve the segmenttagger at all, and thus new members of the new segments will be instantly added as they come along, which is a big improvement over the existing scheme which requires the segmenttagger to regenerate the segments.

fields.summary: Workspaces 2.0

issuetype.description: A big user story that needs to be broken down.
issuetype.name: Epic

fields.description:
Motivation:
Workspaces was in the beginning two completly static views and has since been patched and modified to add functionality. This is mainly been done by adding support for user flexibility using the same building blocks that were created in the beginning. This has for the most part been a success story but we are now seeing the "final" limitations of the code. We see this primarily in two places.

1. It is very difficult to create widgets that have non-trivial, multiple request (possibly with inter query dependencies). Evidence of this is the amount of time it took to create the Segment widget, Funnel Widget and Document widget. Creating more of these complex widgets won't take any less time if the building blocks aren't changed.
2. Complex widgets, large workspaces are slow. The root cause of this is that there is a lot of stuff happening in the background (like network request state change) that will result on a complete re-render of the widget/workspaces. This is an expensive operation with our current libraries.

A further (smaller) issue is that the API cache is tied to the workspace/view. This means that if you navigate from view A -> B -> A you will have to do the requests for A twice, even though the first requests are still valid. 

Sollution:
Do a complete rewrite of Workspaces using modern tools (the same tools used to create most of the DMP app).

fields.summary: Cross team development in cx repo

issuetype.description: A big user story that needs to be broken down.
issuetype.name: Epic

fields.description:
We need to make development in cx scalable to multiple teams working in different teams and geographical areas.

 * Introduce the owner concept in cx repo. This is both to document who owns what, but also to enforce who should be involved in a codereview.
 * Replace redo build system with bazel. We need a more standardized build system, and bazel is built to support large repository with owner structure.
 * Generate IDE configuration. The current scheme with hardcoded IDE configuration has some problems, especially when working with other projects with different global rules.
 * Properly integrate cxbuilder with gitlab again. It's currently broken and requires developer to join #cxbuild on slack, which is not scalable with many builds.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

security.description: Issues restricted to internal cx users
security.name: Private internal

fields.summary: Customer isolation - streaming/feeding

issuetype.description: A big user story that needs to be broken down.
issuetype.name: Epic

fields.description:
This will make it possible to scale our streaming infrastructure further and enable customer cube clusters for performance and more fine grained routing to reduce cost.

Requirements:
 * Unlimited number of streams
 * Global distribution
 * Load balancing over multiple servers
 * Read scaling by adding proxies which is independent of write load

A requirement for running dedicated clusters for customers, or for doing efficient reprocessing of only subset of the event stream, we need better feeding infrastructure. Another weakness of today's eventstorer system is that we can't load balance per request over a set of eventstorers; switching requires refeeding.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

security.name: Private internal

fields.summary: SQL support for cube

issuetype.description: A big user story that needs to be broken down.
issuetype.name: Epic

fields.description:
The cube is today more powerful than what is possible to express using the traffic APIs with the traffic filters. We can continue to extend the current APIs, but this is coming increasingly difficult as we want more advanced features. It make sense to take a step back and consider if we should provide SQL as a way forward to support more and more advanced features.

We can come very far by implementing a well thought out subset of SQL: filter, group by, join and functions to transform values.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

security.description: Issues restricted to internal cx users
security.name: Private internal

fields.summary: Scalable segment serving

issuetype.description: A big user story that needs to be broken down.
issuetype.name: Epic

fields.description:
Split out segment serving from apiserver, since it has started to create problems for other systems part of the same process. These problems will increase with larger segments (as will happen in CXANA-5504).

We want this new service to be built from the ground up using our new technology stack, which involves mesos, consul and gRPC.

First version of the service should pull out the segment snapshot specific parts from apiserver, and provide a grpc based API to lookup segments for a set of users using a segment snapshot. The service should be running in mesos in all DCs and be resolvable using consul for service discovery.

This epic is meant to be a minimal solution to get a real production service running. This will serve as a platform for more advanced segment lookup features in the future, and be an example for similar services we want to develop.

fields.summary: Replace cassandra with postgresql in analytics

issuetype.description: A big user story that needs to be broken down.
issuetype.name: Epic

fields.description:
We no longer want to use cassandra, and this epic deals with removing the analytics cassandra.

1. We need postgresql running with at least 3 postgresql replicas in each DC.A single postgresql master with manual failover is fine, but master downtime must not bring down any read-only replicas.
2. Set up analytics to write both to cassandra and postgresql.
3. Run with both cassandra and postgresql for a time, until we are sure postgresql has correct data.
4. Start reading from postgresql instead of cassandra. This must only be done once postgresql is setup for comparable or better availability than cassandra. See INFRA-444 for details.
5. Once all processes has been running stable long enough on top of postgresql, we can remove writes to cassandra.
6. Remove cassandra
7. Start taking advantage of SQL/postgresql

Until the last point, we should aim to have a simple postgresql schema, which can be used by CassandraKeyValueStore. Once we have removed cassandra, we can start to update or replace the code to get a more sane way of dealing with the database.

Please not that this epic will only require a minimal solution necessary to replace cassandra with postgresql. Cleaning up our database model with new tables and classes will be done in a later epic.

fields.summary: Setup postgresql as a replacement for cassandra

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
*Customer:* 
Customer Name : NEXT_DMP
Site Group Id: 9222331231489233874
Segment Id: 8oaw268vvd9q

*[Support Ticket 13002|https://emediate1.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/13002]*

*Summary:*
The DMP segment editor sometimes fails to show the traffic volume (match rate) of the segment

*Business Impact:*
Mostly annoyance - forces customer to keep refreshing screen while working on creating segments

*Details:*
The DMP segment editor sometimes fails to show the traffic volume/match rate of the segment being edited (attachment 1), but all traffic queries seem in spite of this to be successful (attachment 2 shows the traffic in the case of the screenshot in attachment 1). By refreshing the screen one normally gets the expected behavior (attachment 3 is after a successful refresh).

This is the link to the customer's Cxense DMP segment page:
https://dmp.cxense.com/segments-edit?group=9222331231489233874&begin=sod&end=now&segment=8oaw268vvd9q&selectedWorkspaceId=14d66620fbe4e73acfec13be77db7667533b1c88

As this is an intermittent problem I'm not able to come up with a reproduction procedure that always works. One just have to keep refreshing the page repeatedly until the issue appears.

Could it be that there is some timeout value that sometimes are exceeded and thus lead to this issue?

fields.summary: DMP GUI: segment match rate should not be re-evaluated on name and description changes

issuetype.description: Issue
issuetype.name: Issue

fields.description:
I had just waited a couple of minutes for my segment to get done with its "Calculating match rate..."

I started giving it a description, but the second I started typing, it started re-evaluating - and I waited 3 minutes this time.

Started giving it a shorter name (since the length blocked me from saving), and re-eval happened again (but only about 30s this time).

So this is probably not an issue for basic segments, but for heavy ones it is kind of sad.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

security.description: Issues restricted to internal cx users
security.name: Private internal

fields.summary: /dmp/traffic/data appending instead of overwriting

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
/dmp/traffic/data  (https://wiki.cxense.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=31198977)

I think i found a bug. I believe both problems are the same. It looks like executing this method append members instead of overwriting them. For example:

CASE A:
/segment/data/update?experimental=true
 {"segmentId":"8noq1najpbnt", "members":[]}

It doesn't remove the members.

CASE B:
{"segmentId":"8noq1najpbnt", "members":[{"type":"cx", "id":"cx:td11x7gt3mz527bba03ljo6ug:1j7pz64vuqawn"}]}

On the DMP shows 2 unique users. It seems that the previous user is still in the segment although it should have been removed based on this 
commands.

SitegroupId: 9222337937877397892

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open
